text: The one who boasts does so only out of a feeling of inferiority.
author: Alfred Adler

text: If you love somebody, let them go, for if they return, they were always yours. If they don't, they never were.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
author: Robert Frost

text: A poet should be so crafty with words that he is envied even for his pains.
author: Criss Jami

text: When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.
author: Lao Tzu

text: The fewer the words, the better the prayer.
author: Martin Luther

text: It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live, remember that.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: Everybody needs a passion. That's what keeps life interesting.
author: Betty White

text: Success is not what you do when you are on top.  Success is how high you bounce when you hit the bottom.
author: Sonia Ricotti

text: Life's too mysterious to take too serious.
author: Mary Engelbreit

text: The world is open for play, everything and everybody is mockable in a wonderful way.
author: Robin Williams

text: Your next step is simple. You are the first domino.
author: Gary Keller

text: If you haven't the strength to impose your own terms upon life, then you must accept the terms it offers you.
author: T.S. Eliot

text: Nothing is too high for a man to reach, but he must climb with care and confidence
author: Hans Christian Andersen

text: There is peace even in the storm.
author: Vincent van Gogh

text: There are people who have money and people who are rich.
author: Coco Chanel

text: Character is the result of two things: mental attitude and the way we spend our time.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: Nature is pleased with simplicity. And nature is no dummy.
author: Isaac Newton

text: Life would be tragic if it weren't funny.
author: Stephen Hawking

text: Always be a first rate version of yourself and not a second rate version of someone else.
author: Judy Garland

text: Wherever you are, it's the place you need to be.
author: Maxime Lagace

text: A man sees in the world what he carries in his heart.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

text: Knowledge is a treasure, but practice is the key to it.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Find something you love and do it better than everyone else.
author: Gurbaksh Chahal

text: Wrong does not cease to be wrong because the majority share in it.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: You already have every characteristic necessary for success if you recognize, claim, develop and use them.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: The first rule of handling conflict is don't hang around people who are constantly engaging in conflict.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: Our anxiety does not empty tomorrow of its sorrows, but only empties today of its strengths.
author: Charles Spurgeon

text: We will outstretch the hand if you unclench your fist.
author: Barack Obama

text: You can do two things at once, but you can't focus effectively on two things at once.
author: Gary Keller

text: The problem happens when we have multiple desires. When we have fuzzy desires. When we want to do ten different things and we're not clear about which is the one we care about.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: The secret of happiness is not in doing what you like but in liking what you have to do.
author: Sathya Sai Baba

text: A good system shortens the road to the goal.
author: Orison Swett Marden

text: He is a wise man who does not grieve for the things which he has not, but rejoices for those which he has.
author: Epictetus

text: The longer we dwell on our misfortunes, the greater is their power to harm us.
author: Voltaire

text: We win by helping each other win.
author: Jack Butcher

text: Success is liking yourself, liking what you do, and liking how you do it.
author: Maya Angelou

text: Nothing has more strength than dire necessity.
author: Euripides

text: Superstars think like superstars long before the fans or the press anoint them.
author: John Eliot

text: No matter who you are, we're creatures of habit. The better your habits are, the better they will be in pressure situations.
author: Wayne Gretzky

text: Money poisons you when you've got it, and starves you when you haven't.
author: D. H. Lawrence

text: Keep your dreams, you never know when you might need them.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

text: Life reflects your own thoughts back to you.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: True knowledge exists in knowing that you know nothing.
author: Socrates

text: Always forgive your enemies - nothing annoys them so much.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: We can't help everyone, but everyone can help someone.
author: Ronald Reagan

text: Nothing important is learned; it is simply remembered.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

text: One beam, no matter how big, cannot support an entire house on its own.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions.
author: Mark Twain

text: You gain strength, courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Growing up is losing some illusions, in order to acquire others.
author: Virginia Woolf

text: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
author: Seneca

text: Life is to be fortified by many friendships. To love, and to be loved, is the greatest happiness of existence.
author: Sydney Smith

text: Today will never happen again. Don't waste it with a false start or no start at all.
author: Og Mandino

text: Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.
author: Lolly Daskal

text: Life is a long lesson in humility.
author: James Matthew Barrie

text: You can have it all. You just can't have it all at once.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: Anything worth doing is worth doing slowly.
author: Mae West

text: Better to die fighting for freedom than be a prisoner all the days of your life.
author: Bob Marley

text: How you think when you lose determines how long it will be until you win.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

text: Time stays long enough for anyone who will use it.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goals.
author: Sydney Smith

text: Nothing is hopeless; we must hope for everything.
author: Euripides

text: For all evils there are two remedies - time and silence.
author: Alexandre Dumas

text: The smallest of actions is always better than the noblest of intentions.
author: Robin Sharma

text: Every second you have on this planet is very precious and it's your responsibility that you're happy.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: Confidence is contagious. So is lack of confidence.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: Always try to be a little kinder than necessary.
author: James Matthew Barrie

text: Do every act of your life as if it were your last.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given to us.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: You never know when a moment and a few sincere words can have an impact on a life.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: You will not do incredible things without an incredible dream.
author: John Eliot

text: Life and the simple beauty of it is too good to pass up.
author: Christopher McCandless

text: If you do not get the chills when you set your goal you're not setting big enough goals.
author: Bob Proctor

text: If you want to keep your memories, you first have to live them.
author: Bob Dylan

text: The way to change others' minds is with affection, and not anger.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Time flies whether you are having fun or not.
author: Mary Engelbreit

text: Instead of being intimidated by the limitations, be inspired to find new ways around them.
author: Ralph Marston

text: You're never too old for anything.
author: Betty White

text: Identify your problems, but give your power and energy to solutions.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Always render more and better service than is expected of you, no matter what your task may be.
author: Og Mandino

text: Great things are not done by impulse, but by a series of small things brought together.
author: Vincent van Gogh

text: Your work is to discover your work and then, with all your heart, to give yourself to it.
author: Buddha

text: Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try Again. Fail again. Fail better.
author: Samuel Beckett

text: In any moment of decision, the best thing you can do is the right thing. The worst thing you can do is nothing.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Expect the best of yourself, and then do what is necessary to make it a reality.
author: Ralph Marston

text: You are now, and you do become, what you think about.
author: Earl Nightingale

text: Develop success from failures. Discouragement and failure are two of the surest stepping stones to success.
author: Dale Carnegie

text: Excellence is not an exception, it is a prevailing attitude.
author: Colin Powell

text: Still your waters.
author: Josh Waitzkin

text: Tradition is the illusion of permanence.
author: Woody Allen

text: Realize deeply that the present moment is all you ever have.
author: Eckhart Tolle

text: When we allow negative messages to fester in our head, they take on a life of their own.
author: Lolly Daskal

text: Logic is like the sword ? those who appeal to it shall perish by it.
author: Samuel Butler

text: You must live in the present, launch yourself on every wave, find your eternity in each moment. Fools stand on their island of opportunities and look toward another land. There is no other land; there is no other life but this.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: All wealth is the product of labor.
author: John Locke

text: You can never get enough of what you don't need to make you happy.
author: Eric Hoffer

text: He that can have patience can have what he will.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Genius is the ability to act rightly without precedent - the power to do the right thing the first time.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: Happiness is not a goal...it's a by-product of a life well lived.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Always dream and shoot higher than you know you can do. Do not bother just to be better than your contemporaries or predecessors. Try to be better than yourself.
author: William Faulkner

text: Trust, like the soul, never returns once it is gone.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: Be mindful. Be grateful. Be positive. Be true. Be kind.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Change yourself and you have done your part in changing the world.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

text: If you want to know what God thinks about money just look at the people He gives it to.
author: Alexander Pope

text: The first principle of success is desire.
author: Robert Collier

text: Normal is the average of deviance.
author: Rita Mae Brown

text: Art, like morality, consists of drawing the line somewhere.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

text: We think too much and feel too little.
author: Charlie Chaplin

text: Live in the sunshine, swim the sea, drink the wild air.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: In order to be irreplaceable one must always be different.
author: Coco Chanel

text: If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough.
author: Albert Einstein

text: When you believe in a thing, believe in it all the way, implicitly and unquestionable.
author: Walt Disney

text: Our truest life is when we are in dreams awake.
author: Henry David Thoreau

text: I dream my painting and I paint my dream.
author: Vincent van Gogh

text: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
author: Walt Disney

text: In the middle of chaos lies opportunity.
author: Bruce Lee

text: We tend to live up to our expectations.
author: Earl Nightingale

text: Where does a thought go when it's forgotten?
author: Sigmund Freud

text: An investment in knowledge pays the best interest.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: You must conceive it in your heart and mind before you can receive it. If you believe then all things are possible.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: The only defense against the world is a thorough knowledge of it.
author: John Locke

text: If you correct your mind, the rest of your life will fall into place.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Showing off is the fool's idea of glory.
author: Bruce Lee

text: Muddy water is best cleared by leaving it alone.
author: Alan Watts

text: It's your outlook on life that counts.
author: Betty White

text: If you don't know, the thing to do is not to get scared, but to learn.
author: Ayn Rand

text: The whole of life, from the moment you are born to the moment you die, is a process of learning.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

text: Fears are nothing more than a state of mind.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: You may be disappointed if you fail, but you are doomed if you don't try.
author: Beverly Sills

text: Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work.
author: Aristotle

text: Your hardest times often lead to the greatest moments of your life. Keep going. Tough situations build strong people in the end.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Life goes by fast. Enjoy it. Calm down. It's all funny.
author: Joan Rivers

text: Fools resist. The wise embrace.
author: Maxime Lagace

text: True wealth is of the heart, not of the purse.
author: Og Mandino

text: Never spend your money before you have earned it.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Progress is impossible without change, and those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: This is the real secret of life - to be completely engaged with what you are doing in the here and now. And instead of calling it work, realize it is play.
author: Alan Watts

text: People often say that motivation doesn't last. Well, neither does bathing - that's why we recommend it daily.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: Fear is a natural reaction to moving closer to the truth.
author: Pema Chodron

text: You're on earth. There's no cure for that.
author: Samuel Beckett

text: To be angry is to revenge the faults of others on ourselves.
author: Alexander Pope

text: Rudeness is the weak man's imitation of strength.
author: Eric Hoffer

text: The primary point of this existence is to live, and all living things move and grow.
author: Ming-Dao Deng

text: Deliberately seek the company of people who influence you to think and act on building the life you desire.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: Go for it now. The future is promised to no one.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: Show me a hero, and I'll write you a tragedy.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

text: We may not be responsible for the world that created our minds, but we can take responsibility for the mind with which we create our world.
author: Gabor Mate

text: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.
author: Aristotle

text: Success is not to be pursued, it is to be attracted by the person you become.
author: Jim Rohn

text: Never put off to tomorrow what you can do to-day.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: The way we feel is the direct result of what we think.
author: Peter A. Cohen

text: Do not be so open-minded that your brains fall out.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

text: There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you.
author: Maya Angelou

text: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
author: Aristotle

text: He who can, does.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Projecting your mind into a successful situation is the most powerful means to achieve goals.
author: Estee Lauder

text: Inspire yourself to be great. Being good isn't good enough.
author: Gurbaksh Chahal

text: If you are lucky enough to find love, remember it is there and don't throw it away.
author: Stephen Hawking

text: Nothing is more real than nothing.
author: Samuel Beckett

text: Go as far as you can see and you will see further.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: The majority of what you want will come from the minority of what you do.
author: Gary Keller

text: If ever you feel like an animal among men, be a lion.
author: Criss Jami

text: Your only obligation in any lifetime is to be true to yourself.
author: Richard Bach

text: It is very obvious that we are not influenced by 'facts' but by our interpretation of the facts.
author: Alfred Adler

text: The more we have the less we own.
author: Meister Eckhart

text: Confidence is what you have before you understand the problem.
author: Woody Allen

text: A Penny Saved is a Penny Earned
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Make each day a new horizon.
author: Christopher McCandless

text: Success is within the reach of just about everyone.
author: Lolly Daskal

text: A scientific man ought to have no wishes, no affections, - a mere heart of stone.
author: Charles Darwin

text: If you don't program yourself, life will program you.
author: Les Brown

text: Before enlightenment; chop wood, carry water. After enlightenment; chop wood, carry water.
author: Buddha

text: It doesn't matter how much you want. What really matters is how much you want it.
author: Ralph Marston

text: Definitions belong to the definers, not the defined.
author: Toni Morrison

text: Nothing has any power over me other than that which I give it through my conscious thoughts.
author: Tony Robbins

text: It doesn't matter where you are coming from. All that matters is where you are going.
author: Brian Tracy

text: Change is inevitable but personal growth is a choice.
author: Bob Proctor

text: Happiness is a choice, not a result. Nothing will make you happy until you choose to be happy.
author: Ralph Marston

text: The biggest adventure you can ever take is to live the life of your dreams.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: Poverty and hardship are created by false thinking.
author: Bodhidharma

text: Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: It still holds true that man is most uniquely human when he turns obstacles into opportunities.
author: Eric Hoffer

text: As you think, so shall you become.
author: Bruce Lee

text: Your conscience is the measure of the honesty of your selfishness. Listen to it carefully.
author: Richard Bach

text: True love stories never have endings.
author: Richard Bach

text: When you realize you've made a mistake, take immediate steps to correct it.
author: Dalai Lama

text: The hard path is often the right one. The river teaches more than the shore.
author: Maxime Lagace

text: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.
author: Walt Disney

text: When you are tough on yourself, life is going to be infinitely easier on you.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: When you've got nothing, you've got nothing to lose.
author: Bob Dylan

text: Dream big. Start small. But most of all, start.
author: Simon Sinek

text: Words are the clothing of our thoughts.
author: Jonathan Swift

text: Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.
author: Seneca

text: Make your mind your own business.
author: Jack Butcher

text: No great discovery was ever made without a bold guess.
author: Isaac Newton

text: Your heart is the size of an ocean. Go find yourself in its hidden depths.
author: Rumi

text: You will face many defeats in life, but never let yourself be defeated.
author: Maya Angelou

text: There is no fear for one whose mind is not filled with desires.
author: Buddha

text: You are free, and that is why you are lost.
author: Franz Kafka

text: Everything starts with a dream. A particle of our imagination that teases us of what the future could be like, as long as we fight for it.
author: Gurbaksh Chahal

text: It's only after you've stepped outside your comfort zone that you begin to change, grow, and transform.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Do not believe that you will reach your destination without leaving the shore.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Opportunity is missed by most people because it is dressed in overalls and looks like work.
author: Thomas Edison

text: Success on the outside means nothing unless you also have success within.
author: Robin Sharma

text: A gentleman is one who puts more into the world than he takes out.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: The past is history. It no longer exists, but you are keeping it alive in your mind through your thoughts.  Let it go. It is not serving you.
author: Sonia Ricotti

text: Stop being a prisoner of your past. Become the architect of your future.
author: Robin Sharma

text: Change yourself - you are in control.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

text: When we think about our strengths, we are strong. When we think about our weaknesses, we are weak.
author: Peter A. Cohen

text: Hope means hoping when everything seems hopeless.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

text: Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Remember that sometimes not getting what you want is a wonderful stroke of luck.
author: Dalai Lama

text: It ain't where you start in life, it's where you end up, and what you did along the way.
author: Colin Powell

text: The highest level of wisdom is when you not only accept but love adversity.
author: Maxime Lagace

text: Leaders think and talk about solutions. Followers think and talk about the problems.
author: Brian Tracy

text: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
author: William James

text: Fear can hold you prisoner. Hope can set you free.
author: Stephen King

text: We build too many walls and not enough bridges.
author: Isaac Newton

text: Focus on how far you have come in life rather than looking at the accomplishments of others.
author: Lolly Daskal

text: To handle yourself, use your head; to handle others, use your heart.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: A leader is best when people barely know he exists, when his work is done, his aim fulfilled, they will say: we did it ourselves.
author: Lao Tzu

text: If the misery of the poor be caused not by the laws of nature, but by our institutions, great is our sin.
author: Charles Darwin

text: The measure of who we are is what we do with what we have.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: Definiteness of purpose is the starting point of all achievement.
author: W. Clement Stone

text: Problems remain as problems because people are busy defending them rather than finding solutions.
author: Celestine Chua

text: Do what you feel in your heart to be right ? for you'll be criticized anyway.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: All happiness depends on courage and work.
author: Honore de Balzac

text: When you are talented you do it whatever it is until your fingers bleed or your eyes are ready to fall out of your head.
author: Stephen King

text: A gentleman accepts the responsibility of his actions and bears the burden of their consequences.
author: William Faulkner

text: One day, in retrospect, the years of struggle will strike you as the most beautiful.
author: Sigmund Freud

text: We must learn to live together as brothers or perish together as fools.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

text: Do not try to be on the side of the majority, but live according to your inner laws.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: The quality of your life is the quality of your relationships.
author: Tony Robbins

text: Remain calm, serene, always in command of yourself. You will then find out how easy it is to get along.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

text: Beauty is not in the face; beauty is a light in the heart.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: Yesterday is but today's memory, tomorrow is today's dream.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: If you're afraid - don't do it, - if you're doing it - don't be afraid!
author: Genghis Khan

text: Failure is the highway to success.
author: Og Mandino

text: To arrive at the simplest truth requires years of contemplation.
author: Isaac Newton

text: The traveler sees what he sees. The tourist sees what he has come to see.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

text: People do not decide their futures, they decide their habits and their habits decide their futures.
author: Gary Keller

text: Never regret your past. Rather, embrace it as the teacher that it is.
author: Robin Sharma

text: When uncomfortable, my instinct is not to avoid the discomfort but to become at peace with it.
author: Josh Waitzkin

text: I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: You can't build a reputation on what you are going to do.
author: Henry Ford

text: The more one judges, the less one loves.
author: Honore de Balzac

text: Why fit in when you were born to stand out?
author: Dr. Seuss

text: It's better to stand by someone's side than by yourself.
author: Jack London

text: Nourish the mind like you would your body. The mind cannot survive on junk food.
author: Brian Tracy
